caption: While in the Bay Ridge area, made a impromptu stop at this lovely little restaurant. Everything tasted fresh and high quality. We ordered the Russian bread appetizer, warm, and flavorful. For mains we had the risotto and and roast chicken. The roast chicken skin was especially lovely with the perfect skin crust that was like meat candy. 😋. We wrapped things up the chocolate caramel tart and the beet and carrot cake, both also very good. They also had a live musician which was better than many live performance I've been to in the past, made for a great ambiance.
Highly recommend!!!
My boyfriend and I frequent this place almost every weekend now. Slava and his family and team are second to none.  We love them and their farm to table fresh food.  Keep up the great work team 🖤

The burger, pastas, and other menu items are incredible. The burger can be a little over salted at times, but the wild boar papardelle more than makes up for it. The stuffed cabbage is good, as is the pepper rigatoni and most other menu items. The chef is very warm and friendly, with lots of experience in the kitchen. You must try their sorbet/ice cream combo of lavender and berry. It tastes so fresh, and is served in such a pretty way. One amenity that they don't really have is a bathroom. But if you really need it, you can request to walk through the kitchen to the tiny bathroom that's not easily accessible. Don't miss out on this place! Some of the best food in the area.

With an acoustic tile ceiling and tile floor, this is not an visually appealing restaurant and I would have never gone if not for recommendations from friends.  The food is artfully created and delicious and I would definitely go back.  I took a star off because we waited 2 hours for our entrées even thoughthe restaurant was not crowded.   No photos because we were too hungry to eat.  The sunchokes cooked 3 ways were divine as was the Russian black bread appetizer.  The stuffed cabbage was truly delicious (something I am generally not a fan of).  Also tried the pumpkin mac and cheese which was tasty but I probably wouldn't order it again.
Yummy food! Great for kids too! Love it!

This restaurant is one of the hidden gems in Bay Ridge for sure! The food is so fresh and flavorful. The meals are so beautifully prepared you feel bad eating them. Service is outstanding. I've eaten both inside the restaurant and during the Covid times in the cute little "green house" that sits out front. The inside of the restaurant is very warm and inviting. The green house seats 4 people and is surprisingly warm (no coat required). The beet and carrot hummus is amazing and that is coming from someone who is not a fan of hummus. The veggie burger is the best I've had so far. The pumpkin Mac and cheese is delicious. You have to try the lavender and berry ice cream/ sorbet combo. It's like eating a lavender flower over ice. Amazing and definitely perfect for when you think you're too full for dessert but still want to try something. Such a lovely experience eating here! Coming back for brunch with the girls soon!
Love the food. Master chef!

After seeing several post about this place on Facebook, I finally got around to experience the magic that is Beets and Carrots. The food and service is utterly outstanding. I was able to sit inside the cute little "house" outside of the restaurant since indoor dining is still not permitted in NY and I was very comfortable. No heater required. My server was so nice and he brought me out extra items to try while I waited for my food. Everything was just wonderful. So fresh and delicious. My Alaskan Salmon was beautifully cooked. I will definitely be back!

This place is AMAZING! Top notch freshness combined with a beautiful combo of flavors. True farm to table! Nice menu offering variety for all dietary needs. We loved the beet pasta and black bread (made with cocoa, rye, coffee bean with carrot butter and citrus marmalade). Grits, duck sausage and shrimp cooked to perfection. The facade is unassuming but the food can rival any high end NYC restaurant. This place is an absolute gem that needs more recognition! We enjoyed comfortable outdoor dining under heat lamps. Nice vibe with jazz playing and beautiful view of the Verrazano on a brisk day. Support this place you won’t be sorry!
Chef is genius and this place has exceptional food. I feel very lucky to stay close to this restaurant. This place should be in Manhattan.

Five stars well deserved! The food here is so delicious and healthy that I can keep ordering. The chef is incredible and keeps experimenting with creative dishes and I am a fan! It’s a farm to table kinda thing and so very amazing!

This is one of my favorite restaurants of all time. Fresh, excellently cooked food with a great energy and awesome service. Super cozy interior. Have live music on the weekends and heaters outside. Everything I've tried is delicious each time. Can't wait to go back!
Great food, warm and friendly staff! I loved the live music! I had the beet bucatini and my boyfriend had the stuffed tomato, delicious!!!!

We go here almost every week and we love the food. The only thing that was wrong when we got it this time was my husband's burger was a little undercooked, so we had to put it in the oven for a bit longer, but other then that it is really good.
Excellent food and customer service
Always so good, and the chef is super friendly! They are open, and as delicious as always.
Very nice restaurant. Food is delicious there! I think its the most important for the restaurant.
You lose yourself in this little nook of a place in bay ridge! Excellent cooking, never disappointed, slightly high in price but well worth every penny!

Stopped by today for lunch, they have such an amazing breakfast options. Buckwheat pancakes blowed out my mind!!! Menu is great, nice and simple, but has a lot of different options. Service is fantastic, Diana went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. Highly recommend!
Awesome that's all I have to say
Pricey, but delicious

My only destination in Bay Ridge for fine dining. Chef is an artist with a great human nature inside. Very friendly environment and fresh produced farm to table kitchen. Lavender ice-cream is a must to taste!

My number One rated place in Brooklyn. The menu from the chef is a state of art and is being cooked daily, fresh and super delicious. I love everything about this restaurant: food, vibe, service, atmosphere. Five Stars!
Yummy food.
Superb!
The beet bucatini with duck is tremendous - if you have a few extra dollars to drop on a meal this is one of the best spots in Bay Ridge.
We enjoyed a lovely dinner here in January. The staff was attentive and the chef was delightful. Everything we enjoyed was delicious
Food is delicious there! Nice, small, cozy restaurant which is a great addition to Bay Ridge.
Really nice place. Food is delicious! Definitely worth to stop by

In times like this .. COVD... I am so thankful that a great chef like Slav..  is still sharing his great cooking with us...  today I had the delicious pumpkin soup, half herb chicken and caramel/chocolate salt ice cream...  mmmmmm..  so gooood!   My boyfriend had the Amish burger... everything was delicious ... I know it is hard to have it straight out of the oven ..  but all I did was heat up the oven and and put the food in for a few minutes ... sat down and enjoyed every bite!!!   Can’t wait to go back and enjoy his other special dishes..  love the bucatini with lamb..  his great breakfast dishes ... and so many others I still have to try..  everitme I try one fish I fall in love with it..  it is really an eating experience!
this was an interesting place not what I'm used to
Very nice place to eat. I highly recommend the salmon. Friendly staff and decor give a warm and welcoming feeling
Nice cuisine,  fresh food.
Amazing delicious food,high esthetic presented with great service and jazzy atmosphere!!! BRAVO!!!
The food was beyond delicious!!! I went for breakfast/lunch can’t wait to try out the dinner selections.
We went for lunch: home cooked food with real quality ingredients, it was simple delicious and very reasonably priced.  I will be going back again soon!
Nice people, nice service, mediocre food and very small portions.  I won't go back

We went here on New Year’s Eve and had an absolutely delicious dinner. There were 3 of us and we each ordered something different. For appetizer we had the Foie Gras Brulee, Cauliflower and Pumpkin Soup. These were outstanding. Absolutely delicious starters. (held ourselves back from licking the plates). Our entrees were Wild Boar Papardelle, Veal Cheeks and Beef Stroganoff and one side Duck Sausage. These were very good as well. The only caveat was that we brought 2 bottles of wine – didn’t mind the corkage fee $10 however, since we were such a small party and ordered Espresso we felt the corkage fee for the dessert wine at the end should not have been charged. But that doesn’t take away from the 5 STAR awesome dinner.  Thanks for a great meal Beets and Carrots!

Amazing food and ambience. Upscale cafe with delicious fresh food at very reasonable prices for the level of food that you get. Wonderfully friendly staff and low key music made for an awesome brunch. There’s also takeaway options and tables for singles. Will definitely be back!
Truly delicious food and excellent service! The kitchen is not super+ fast, but it's well worth the wait.

This place is amazing!!! The environment is so inviting and relaxing. This is a family owned restaurant that puts love in every plate. They use locally grown seasonal organic ingredients (which is my favorite part). Into every plate goes a great level of detail and precision. I try to make it here every time I’m in Bay Ridge. I highly recommended.
Spent a long weekend in Brooklyn and liked this place so much we went twice, first for dinner and then for brunch. Both were excellent thanks to attentive staff and delicious food!
Very cozy, food is delicious. All the ingredients are organic and come from a farm. Family owned business.
Nice to find some healthy, and tasty juice.

Delicious restaurant! I am big on healthy clean food and this restaurant is everything i needed during my visit to new york. The restaurant is beautiful with a very healing atmosphere and cute plants at each table. The food is excellent, very flavorful and healing for the tummy! Everything is homemade from scratch and super yummy! I had the Russian soup, half chicken, and mixed berry sorbet. I also had all the coffee which was yummy! The people who work there are very kind and attentive. I have a very special diet and they listened to me and were able to accommodate it. I highly recommend this restaurant!
A real 'hidden gem', didn't disappoint, a wonderful breakfast experience. We had   the baked eggs and the French toast. The coffee was good too. Highly recommended!
Food was fresh, delicious. Service was great.

Where is the 6th star to give this amazing place!! The food here is AMAZING everything is fresh and the chef is nice, kind and VERY TALENTED!  The wait staff is attentive and very friendly. I have eaten here many many times!!!!!

Popped in cuz the wife and I had a few hours to burn in Bay Ridge and we were hungry. This is local farm to table elevated - mix of Italian, Russian, and other influences. Tried a salad and a pasta and both were superb. Def coming back.

The food here is phenomenal. The fresh pasta is always unique and  perfect. The home made ice cream and sorbet is out of this world. The homemade bread super excellent. The flavor pairings can either be deeply complex and balanced, or a blend of simple that lets the fresh quality shine. While folks call this restaurant expensive, it can be, but it is entirely worth it.
Excellent food. Everything that comes out of this kitchen is divine.
obviously it's a healthy place with vegan and vegetarian choices, which i am neither. Yet, i found all dished are delightful!
If you are still mourning the loss of Petit Oven, here's a place for you. Tried it today for a quick lunch and cannot wait to return for dinner.

Well you will be in for a treat. One of those Bay Ridge gems. A few tables, great music, mostly jazz and the menu is seasonal. My wife loved it the wild boar pasta was amazing and the dessert was out of the realm of saturated sugar and fat that you commonly encounter. You must go there and try it to taste really curated flavors. Only for people who appreciate fine cuisine.

Love how the chef executes the dishes. Cheeks are the best! Parpadelle is wonderful:-) Seasonal summer veggie preparation is fantastic! Small quiet restaurant, doesn't disappoint. NOTE: BYOB (Liquor store next door) - Beets & Carrots charges $10 corkage fee:-/

I have to say I am extremely impressed. Was just in the neighborhood and wanted to get something to eat before i go in to get a facial. I walked in and was quickly greeted and was served water immediately.  I ordered a breakfast dish of polenta, mushroom, spinach with 1 egg. It was gorgeous and very delicious. The place was clean and not crowded. Nice soothing music and at no time was i rushed.  Coffee was also delicious. Very nice place with a very healthy menu. Thank you.

Amazing food!!! The Chef makes you feel very welcomed there. He cooks every dish as a piece of art, but the most important is that everything we ordered was very fresh, delicious, and flavorful. I highly recommend this cozy restaurant.

I was skeptical based the name but this was a great find. It is a bring your own drink place so keep that in mind if you drink (alcohol) when you eat. The service was excellent and the staff was very friendly. The food was out of this world. The Russian black bread with carrot butter and orange marmalade was fantastic. The veal cheek and peas just fell apart on the fork. The overall menu was very interesting with a little of everything, including vegetarian and vegan if you like that sort of thing. Will be going back next time I’m in town.
If it wasnt for bree, this store wouldnt exist. TIP HER WELL
Lovely place with outstanding food and service!  And nice jazz....
So much to love about this restaurant. PHENOMENAL food and service. I’ll be back many times for this delicious treat

The service was phenomenal. The waitress and chef were super attentive and nice. The food was amazing! I would definitely suggest the pumpkin Mac and cheese. The place is also a cute place. Definitely reccomend this place and will be coming again!
Absolutely delicious food. The burgers are delicious grass fed organic amish raised beef and the vegan food is equally delicious and sourced from the finest farms.

Food is made with lots of love every bite is sooooo delicious. If I could eat here every day I would. Super fresh ingredients are farm to table which makes it a little pricy but it’s worth every penny.

Just amazing, maybe the best food i have had in brooklyn, the pasta came with parmesan foam, the hummus we had was colurful and tasty and the service was fantastic. I am amazed there isn't a line waiting for a table, especially since the price was so reasonable.
Excellent, food was delicious and staff was extremely courteous!
Great place

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, did I say that I love this place? I have been here a bunch of times now and I can say without a doubt that this will be the best food you will get in Brooklyn. I would describe the restaurant as cozy but the food taste as if you have a personal 5 star chef delivering food catered to your specific tatse buds! Don't miss out this amazing experience.

Absolutely delicious. They obviously put a lot of thought into the ingredients, and everything combines beautifully - visual presentation and flavor selections are both unexpected and an absolute delight (I wanted to eat everyone else's dishes too)

Small yet lovely Italian-meets-Russian restaurant run by Russian couple. Cozy interior with beautiful homey touches, cookbooks, a small children's play area, and tongue in cheek references to beets and carrots. Food is well thought out and prepared by the husband with a gourmet flair (pumpkin soup with foam?!), while the wife managed the front of house with the warmest hospitality one could ever receive. A dining experience not to be overlooked in Bay Ridge!
The best chef ever.I love this place..
Delicious and different!

Fellow Foodies, we need to save this one-man kitchen in the hinterland of Bay Ridge, at 3rd Ave and 99th Street.  Beet & Carrot's professionally trained Russian chef confects his Euro-Russo, haute-provincial plates from farm to table, using dairy sourced from the Amish and meats from a family farm upstate.  What you get at Beets & Carrots is not chi-chi frou-frou, but gourmet reality, at way below Manhattan market price.  How about veal cheeks braised in red wine on polenta?  Or mini turnips stuffed with mushrooms?  And the description of beets on pumpkin puree for an amuse-bouche, or salad of roasted root vegetables for a contorno, cannot do justice to the soulfulness of judgment and taste in this chef's confection of his plates.  Each is its own world.  The chef  is doing this all on his own, in a closet of a kitchen, without so much as the help of a dishwasher, never mind a sous-chef, as his wife runs the airy, bright, kitcheny dining space.  That means a long wait for the food, but a wait well worth it.  Problem is, this is not quite the neighborhood for this chef's gustatory artistry.  A year ago, the menu had 3 dozen offbeat offerings.  The current one-page menu looks diner.  The Park Slope friend I convinced to come out to Bay Ridge eyed both it and me with uncensored censoriousness.  So we set the menu aside and went for the blackboard specials, making a special request for small tasting plates.  Feast your eyes on the pics attached, as we did on the food.  And the chef overruled our declining dessert, insisting on a complimentary taste of his pumpkin bread made with pignoli and olive oil, topped with a beet sorbet.  Moaning good.  Now, no offense, but how many Bay Ridgers are going to go for veal cheeks?  Not enough, I'm afraid.  This is not food for the squeamish, the snobbish, or the plebs.  This is food for the skinny glutton, the gourmet adventurer, the traveling foodie. I promise you, it will be worth the trip.  Take the R train to the 95th Street station on 4th Ave, and walk up to 99th St and over to 3rd.  There is a wine shop on the corner of 99th and 3rd where you can pick up a bottle, since Beets and Carrots is BYOB, not having space enough for a regulation size bathroom to qualify for a liquor license.  But are you going to complain about BYOB?  In my opinion, this chef is too personally inventive to be limited by a menu. I think he should offer only chef's choice everyday, making the best of his personally picked ingredients and culinary inventiveness.  Set up a big black board on the sidewalk with the day's offerings a la carte, and a pris fixe for four small plates.  Big problem with my idea is, not much foot traffic that far up 3rd Ave.  He needs a following, so you fools for food need to trek out to the Shore Rd boundary of Bay Ridge.  Come, pioneering palates, for pioneering plates under the Verrazano.  If it's a nice day, you can saunter down 3rd avenue to 95th Street, to Paneantico, where you can pick up the very best in Old world artisanal brick oven bread, or almond biscotti, or sundries of classic Italian bakery and deli .
Great menu...hard to pick out a favourite amongst all we tried. Amazing food
Very good food and service. Definitely will come again.

Fantastic little place. Quiet atmosphere, amazing food and service and fairly priced. My wife and I started with the hummus. It was a little chunky and one of the best hummus I’ve tried in a while. For our mains, we tried the cauliflower and I had the gnocchi with mushrooms, both were very flavorful and fresh. The beets and carrot cake and ice cream was also amazing and a great finish to a delicious meal. Both the owner/chef and waiter were really friendly and welcoming. All this together makes me want to highly recommend this place and keep coming back here myself.
You must try this place. You won't be disappointed by the dinner menu.  Very creative and reliably delicious. There's something for everyone.  Breakfast is outstanding as well.

The place is very cute and cozy. I thought the food was wonderful. The Chef is a really great guy who puts a lot of time, love, and energy into the meals he creates. I really recommend checking the place out. byob, there is a wine store next door.
Great place to eat, and relax. The owners/staff are very pleasant, warm people. The food was delicious, and moderately priced. (Also child friendly). Highly recommend!
Authentic farm to table. The quality, presentation and most importantly the taste of the food is Magical. I’m grateful for the experience!
Best meal I had in NY!!! Fresh and tasty. Awesome staff.
Nice to have a great place near the Verrazano Bridge! After a great meal just steps away for a nice walk. Food and service was great! Pasta and risotto a must try!!
Hidden gem lovely staff wonderful chef food is excellent

FOR FOODIES ONLY!! Went to Beets & Carrots for my friends birthday.  There were 3 of us for dinner.  The food here is delicious, fresh and original.  They buy their food from local farmers so the menu changes all the time - depending upon what's in season.  The Chef is from Europe and he's a genius.  Homemade pasta, baby squid with arugula, polenta, gnocchi, spaghetti with wild boar sauce, banana sorbet....  Everything is excellent! It's a culinary experience!   So why not 5 stars?  The atmosphere... or should I say the lack of atmosphere.  This venue was originally a deli and it still kind of has that feel to it...  Also, to get to the bathroom you need to walk through the kitchen. And no liquor license.. All this turns some people off... but I couldn't care less.  The food is THAT good.  The staff is also extremely accommodating and friendly.... it feels more like you're visiting friends than out to eat in a restaurant.  Until the check comes, of course. It's mid-range but "looks" like it should be cheaper... until you lift your fork!  So, if you appreciate amazing food and friendly but not fancy atmosphere, try Beets and Carrots.... you won't be sorry.
Good and healthy food.
Great
Great chef, and amazing food. Quite little place you can bring your kids.
Highly recommend the stuffed cabbage. Best meal I have had in a long time.
Excellent food

Best food in the city, in a nice, casual atmosphere.  Pastas, salads, and fish are outstanding, and the specials always amaze.  The desserts and baked goods (all made in house) are exceptional.  I"m lucky I live nearby!
Really good food. No alcohol. Good prices.
Excellent locally sourced food.
A friend of mine suggested we meet there for dinner when she returns from vacation, but I couldn't wait. The food is incredible- everything is so fresh.  I'll be back!
Fine establishment with extraordinarily delicious food. Will need to make a stop here every time I’m in the area
Guy knows how to cook, everything is fresh and extremely flavorful

We had the crepe & the full breakfast. Both were DELICIOUS and fairly priced. The crepe is light & topped with Nutella, fresh strawberries & bananas. Full breakfast has delightfully seasoned crispy potatoes, two eggs, sausage, bacon, & beans. Well worth a trip.

EXCELLENT food. Very polite staff. Great atmosphere.  The chef's pasta game is legit.  Edit: I continue to come here on a semi-frequent basis. It has never disappointed and always beets (yes, pun intended) expectations. He prepares incredible things that I hope more people in the neighborhood try. Whenever my wife and I come in, we always hear whispers of other patrons of just how great this food is.
Amazing fresh homemade and satisfying taste with every bite. Can’t wait to go back
this place is really good the food was great

Awesome friendly service with excellent homemade foods with quality, fresh ingredients. Yummy pumpkin mac n cheese. Delicious beet and carrot cake. Healthy crepes with fruit. Great breakfast sausage n bacon w eggs n perfectly cooked potatoes. Lots of other menu choices.
Great food. All the pasta is made fresh in house. It's 4 star food at a fraction of the price. I will be back.

Very good intimate restaurant makes excellent dishes and dynamite pumpkin soup. My only criticism is that they do not have the traditional Ukrainian beet soup borscht. It should be on their menu. Not too many this is that incorporate beets. They offer a very eclectic menu with American and Italian dishes. Very fresh. Small and intimate place is on 3rd Avenue near Shore Road and Marine. Slightly off the beaten path I would recommend this restaurant as a place that you should try. Not for family I suspect but a great place to meet for a date.
Third time eating dinner here, and never had a thing on the menu that wasn't extraordinary.  Chef really knows his food!!

Kinda miss the old italian deli that was there, but this new place is pretty good, ate breakfast there and the quality of food is 100% fresh, staff is kind, and they bring you a few complimentries, the prices are ok, definitley gonna be going back
Simply excellent.
Best blue berry muffins I've ever had. They're made fresh in house. Yum

(Translated by Google) Everything is very tasty, fast and comfortable. I especially want to note the cappuccino, in the beirge there are few where so delicious.  (Original) Всё очень вкусно, быстро и уютно. Особенно хочу отметить капучино, в бейридже мало где такой вкусный.

I really enjoyed my meal here. We we're welcomed with a lovely light dish the chef concocted, featuring a nice medley of light and refreshing textures and flavor.  Lots of healthy and tasty farm to table options in a warm, neighborhood environment.  You can tell they really care here, hidden gem!
Absolutely delicious. Also very intimate.

Excellent food. Pictured - Beet and Carrot Hummus - Risotto with Corn, Peas and Shrimp - Swiss Chard gnocchi with mushroom ragu.  Tip - no bathroom and no liquor license. Grab a drink and use the toilet at Kitty Kiernans or Wicked Monk before heading over.

Food is solid and priced right. However, if you want to pay cash, they have no change. If you want to pay card, they can't figure out the register. It is awkward to stay and have your food since there is no music, yet you will be guilted when you request your food to-go. Still working out kinks and figuring out what kind of restaurant to be, but the effort with the fresh food and menu cannot be overlooked.
Amazing staff, food tasted amazing and fresh, definitely will come again.
Fantastic food

The food is so delicious! I had local angus beef with pasta and ragu sauce; it was out of this world. Wanted extra bread to dip all the sauce. Also had the homemade mix berry pie. And the chef gave us a starter complimentary.  This place is new, and the last few businesses using this location havent done well; but i hope this place is successful b/c it's so delicious!

A comfortable, relaxed setting paired with an exquisite, homemade dish - a meal well spent! Perfect for brunch and dinner, filled with healthy options with ingredients from all local farms, and even Amish eggs and dairy: Bay Ridge needs more establishments like this! My personal favorite: the quinoa, asparagus, prosciutto, and parmigiano salad. Dining here is definitely a must!

If you care to go to a new and not your typical  place and support local farming and local business, then this is the place to check out. Their food is very special. Every dish is made with personal touch. I was excited to  find a play-space for my kids to explore while my husband and I enjoyed our midday coffee with delicious dessert. We are definitely making this spot our go-to place for family luncheons and fun dinners.
Hip and comfortable setting, and delicious meals for a great price! Amazing experience, will definitely come back for more!!

Fresh, delicious, cheap, and organic food. Never new you can actually eat healthy and enjoy your food until I came here. This place is also very nice to visit with your family even with the youngsters.
Amazing!!!!! Like No other place in brooklyn
Excellent place and the food is outstanding. I'm for sure returning to try more of this place.   :)

A welcomed addition to the neighborhood! This unassuming farm-to-table cafe is a real gem in Bay Ridge, a neighborhood once bustling with great restaurant options. Williamsburg and Park Slope have taken over the food scene in Brooklyn and I could absolutely picture Beets & Carrots  in those parts of our fine boro, but boy am I glad that chef-owner and his wife chose to open their business here!!!  We started our late lunch/early dinner with complimentary house-made basil and lime lemonade, followed by a vegetable starter from the chef. From there, we enjoyed a course of pasta - rigatoni with tomatoes and mozzarella, as well as their signature baby beets & carros cappelletti and rainbow radish, soups (chilled corn and warm tomato), a lovely and rather massive burger, crispy chicken with mushrooms and buckwheat, and finally finished with some banana frozen yogurt and banana and raisin ice-cream. The family-friendly atmosphere made for a very enjoyable and relaxing meal, with our two kids enjoying not only the food but also the company of other patrons' and the owners' children as well.  The clientele skewed younger than many Bay Ridge restaurants, hopefully signaling the changing demographics in our area and a wave towards more eateries like Carrots & Beets to come.  Wishing this wonderful new business much success and we look forward to being back here regularly.
Excellent fries, fresh pasta. A touch of luxury in the basics. It's only been open weeks, lots to come! Kids enjoyed the crepes with cream and fruits.
Amazing place! Perfect spot for those of us who love true gourmet food at a fraction of a price! Love it. ❤️❤️❤️

I loved this place! The owner was so nice. I went in for a breakfast frittata and ended up spending an hour there as the owner brought me little samples from every part of the menu.  To start: the homemade lemonade with basil was fabulous. Refreshing but not overpowering. He also brought me a handful of salad and veggie sides with beets, which I usually don't like, but this totally changed my mind! Really tasty and surprising. And of course- the frittata was delicious too.  This is a welcome addition to the neighborhood (open July 2017) and I will definitely be back.
